div.div: Σειρήν , pl. Σειρῆνες, du. Σειρήνοιιν: pl., the Sirens, two in number, singing maidens, by their enchanting song luring mariners to destruction, Od. 12.39 ff., 158, 167, 198, Od. 23.326. (The conception of the Sirens as bird-footed and three in number, as seen in the cut, is post-Homeric.)
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
